fields.name: Etag
fields.description: The etag field is *not* required. If it is provided in the response body, it must also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

fields.name: Id
fields.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

fields.name: Kind
fields.description: Indicates the type of scheduled query rule. The default is LogAlert.

fields.name: Location
fields.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

fields.name: Properties
fields.description: The rule properties of the resource.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"
